oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Travel Trash Can at Sears, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1959, Vol. 2 p. 7
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of a man standing beside one of the City Beautiful Commission's travel trash cans at the corner of Lafayette Street and Lea Avenue, in the Sears parking lot. Photographer unknown. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1959. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
